intro: Dichromena sellowiana, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and other nightshades. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, berry-like fruits that contain toxic seeds. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
